Title: plugin dir in "$HOME" isn't possible
description: In a multiuser environment it isn't possible to have a linked in folder for a user. You can put additional shared plugins into /usr/lokal/ and link this, but it is not possible to link to for example $HOME/eclipse A comandline parameter along the -data one would be nice for this. http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=186725

Title: add support for map file entries requiring https
description: Please add support for map file entries which require the https protocol to fetch zip files. For example, if the following type of entry were included in a map file com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0.zip=http://auser:apassword@aserver/groups/web sphere/artemis/ | | | runtime it would translate into the following Ant call to get: https://aserver/groups/websphere/artemis/com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0 .zip" dest="com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0.zip" /> It appears the following calls do not work: http://aserver/groups/websphere/artemis/com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0. zip" dest="com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0.zip" /> http://ausername:apassword@aserver/groups/websphere/artemis/com.ibm.etools .systems.core_5.1.0.zip" dest="com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0.zip" /> https://ausername:apassword@aserver/groups/websphere/artemis/com.ibm.etool s.systems.core_5.1.0.zip" dest="com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0.zip" /> https://aserver/groups/websphere/artemis/com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0 .zip" dest="com.ibm.etools.systems.core_5.1.0.zip" />

Title: [typing][templates] Auto - Bracketing
description:
Visual Works Smalltalk had this feature built in - when a piece of text is 
highlighted, a key combination, followed by any type of bracket key would 
surround the selected text with the type of bracket selected - ({[ - I believe 
this also applied to string delimiters. 

This is a very useful feature in refactoring code for clarity.

Title: Need better icon for object browsers action
description:
The current icon for this action was borrowed from somewhere, and thus risks 
confusing users.  Also, it doesn't really say "object browser" to me.

Title: [CVS Refactoring] Use ReplaceOperation from replace actions
description:
I added a ReplaceOperation for use by the Workspace subscriber update. The 
replace actions should be updated to use this operation.

Title: Release gives no feedback if tag fails
description:
Build: I20030710
releng plugin version: 2.1.0

If I try to "release" a plugin that I don't have commit rights on, it doesn't
report any success or failure.  CVS console says:

cvs tag "/org.eclipse.webdav/v20030714" "/org.eclipse.webdav"
  cvs server: Tagging .
  cvs [server aborted]: could not open lock file
`/home/eclipse/org.eclipse.webdav/,.classpath,': Permission denied
The server reported an error while performing the "cvs tag" command. (took 0:00.328)
Error: org.eclipse.webdav: cvs [server aborted]: could not open lock file
`/home/eclipse/org.eclipse.webdav/,.classpath,': Permission denied

Title: [Sync View] Selection and expansion needs to be fixed
description:
The sync view has always had bad behavior relating to expansion and selection.
We must ensure that we fix these problems in the new sync view. Here is the
summary of the areas that need to be looked at:

1. Expansion should be preserved during the following: 
- an operation performed on a resource and the expansion should not be changed
- changing from one filter mode to another should preserve expansion
- view is closed and re-opened

2. In 2.1 when the sync view was populated the first change was revealed. This
is hard to do in the new sync view because changes are calculated asynchronously
and there is no opportune time to set the selection. Messing with auto-expansion
and selection will confuse people because the view is now dynamic and resources
can be added to the view at the same time as someone is browing it.

Title: Code cleanup
description:
I have been working with org.eclipse.jface as source from HEAD.
There are numerous warnings for:
  Unnecessary casts
  Indirect static field access
  never read private fields
  superfluous semicolons

I would like to volunteer to clean these up.

Title: THAI VIET: The behavior of text editing functions are not correct.
description:
Build driver: Eclipse 2.1.1
OS: Windows platforms

Problem Description
===================
The following text editing functions of StyledText are not conform to Thai 
standard:-

    Caret movement
    Text deletion with Del key
    Text selection

Overview of Thai text editing
=============================
Thai script is written in linear sequence from left to right with the occasional
use of combining character, which is positioned above or below an associated 
base character in presentation.

The behavior of Text editing functions such as caret movement and text deletion 
in Thai are different from these functions in English because combining Thai 
characters must be considered.

The followings are text editing behaviors in Thai standard:
 - Using arrow key to move caret by one cell instead of by one character. 
 - Text insertion is allowed at cell boundary only.
 - Text deletion with Del key will delete a whole cell, not only a baseline 
character.
 - Text deletion with Backspace key can be done on character basis.
 - Text selection or deletion using character cell boundaries means that an 
entire character cell is selected or deleted as a single unit.


Best Regards,
Suwit Srivilairith

Title: [Workbench] [runtime] version check prompt after workspace crash
description:
If you have a fresh workspace and start-up and then kill it (don't shut down 
correctly), you get the version check prompt on your next start-up.

Is this the desired behaviour?

Title: Provide a way to dynamically change the process label shown in the console title and debug view
description:
The use case is that I'm running an external command with a custom launch 
delegate, and the command produces a lot of output I want to sumarize it in 
the process label. In this case the command is an external builder and 
somewhere in the hundreds of lines of output is information about errors and 
warnings generated. I want to change the label displayed in the console title 
bar and in the debug view to say something like "<options>, 5 warnings, 0 
errors". This will quickly let the user know if she needs to scroll back and 
look at the output more closely. Currently that label can only be set to a 
fixed string at the call to DebugPlugin.newProcess() and not changed 
afterwards.

It would also be nice if, as the build is running, I could make it display 
something like "256 builds, 100 pending, 1 failed, 0 warnings, 5 errors" and 
force the labels to be redrawn whenever I want to change those numbers (as I 
interpret the output through the console line tracker).

Title: [Dialog] [Font] Team Share Project wizard does not use dialog font
description:
select a project

context menu team/share project...

Title: G1.3 : XYZ 1.0.0.e334 does not show up under the root feature hierarchy
description:
After installing the efix e334, the configuration view shows the xyz 1.0.0 
feature disabled under the xyz bogus 1.0.0, instead of also showing the xyz 
1.0.0.e334. See attachement.

Title: [find replace] Incremental find should live in its own status bar space
description: I20031008/rebuild Incremental find should live in its own status bar space. Currently it can overwritten by other stuff (e.g. error message, log messages from background tasks, etc.). See also bug 40561 for another possible solution to this problem.

Title: Search dialog not respecting activity enablement
description:
The search page is not respecting the role/activity system.  All search tabs are
show regardless of enablement state.

Title: Keyboard events ignored in Import Plug-ins and Fragments dialog
description:
20031216

The Selection page of the import plug-in and fragments dialog does not respond
to any key events although all other pages in the wizard do. This works fine on
Windows.

STEPS
1) Select Import Plug-ins and Fragments
2) Alt-N to the Selection page
3) None of the menmonics work and you cannot tab

Title: [SSH2] Key Management  - Generate ... progress indicator
description:
After clicking on "Generate" and while the key is generated there should be a
progress indication.

Title: [SSH2] Passphrase validation warning in wizard
description:
The following behavior would be appreciated:

Empty passphrase/Empty confirm:

Typing in passphrase -> no error message.
Typing in confirm -> error message "don't match" (unless they match .)

Empty passphrase/Non-empty confirm

Typing in passphrase text -> error message "don't match" (unless they match .)

@@@@

There could be a warning that not having a passphrase (i.e. both text fields are
empty) is insecure.

Title: [RCP] Provide a way to prevent a view from being hidden (closed) and or moved
description:
In an RCP application I want to be able to prevent views from being hidden 
(closed). Also I'd like an option to lock them in place in order to prevent 
them from being moved and/or resized. There is an internal 
Perspective.canCloseView() method but the API is not exposed anywhere I can 
find.

Use case: user interfaces designed for unsophisticated workers (like data 
entry) need to be very simple. If a secretary closes a view and doesn't know 
how to get it back, or makes it really small by accident, that's an extra call 
to the help desk.

Title: [RCP] Progress view icon "area" shows even if setShowStatusLine(false) is called
description:
Build: M6

If I call IWorkbenchWindowConfigurer.setShowStatusLine(false) in my
WorkbenchAdvisor's preWindowOpen(IWorkbenchConfigurer) method the status line is
hidden.  BUT, the action with a tooltip of "Double click to open Progress View"
which appears in the bottom left of the window still shows.  The action is
missing/can't find its icon so it just shows as empty screen space, but it shows
over views that I put on the left side of the window.

Title: [ViewMgmt] Eclipse config corrupted after trying to alter a View
description:
I am using 3.0 M6.

Each time I tried just moving a View to another position, a blank window 
popped up.  I shut down Eclipse, but couldn't start it up again.  It 
complained with some error (that I unfortunately didn't write down) that said 
to look in the log file for details.  The log output follows (I didn't know 
how much was critical, so I figured that more was better than not enough -- 
hope it all gets through ;-)

In any case, I had to delete my configuration (workspace\.metadata\.plugins) 
so Eclipse could launch again!  Somehow, just moving that View corrupted my 
whole config!

Let me know if you need more info.
Ari

Title: [CVS UI] SSH2 Connection pref pages do not have mnemonics
description: All controls should sport suitable mnemonics.

Title: [RCP] Proposed changes to support branding and layout control in an RCP application
description:
The attachment details some changes we experimented with to support fixed 
layouts, branding of UI elements such as views and tabs, and dynamic 
perspectives.  Following is an outline of the changes.

View behavior changes 
- hide titlebar
- hide close button
- disable dragging
- support for view titlebars without icons

Workbench Window behavior changes
- Applying RTL style to the WorkbenchWindow via –RTL command line switch
- Launching the Workbench with the Window hidden, a.k.a. nogui.

Workbench Themes
- New extension point 
- Allows custom look and feel of views and folders

New hook in WorkbenchAdvisor to support custom contribution managers, a.k.a. 
Custom StatusBar

Title: Hook for resource scheduling rule factory
description:
I20040121

I have released new API that allows clients to ask for the scheduling rule for
various operations (copy, move, delete, validateEdit, setContents, etc).  Many
of these rule requirements actually vary based on the repository provider (for
example CVS needs to lock the parent folder for most operations).  Core needs to
expose something in the TeamHook to allow repository providers to provide a rule
factory.

Title: [Workbench] Plug-ins can't be Run as Run-time Workbench
description:
This is on a Windows 2000 workstation with SP4 installed. I tried cleaning out 
a re-installing 3.0M6 many times. Other people I know who were using 2.1.x did 
not have this problem. I finally reverted to 2.1.2 and everything worked fine.

I followed every possible example of how to create a plug-in, including using 
the example projects provided. Everything works fine until I try to Run or 
Debug as Run-time Workbench. The UI launches, the splash screen appears, the 
program terminates, and the splash screen is still open. It can only be shut 
down by killing the process. The .log file shows:

Title: [SSH2] Don't need "(yes no)" in host key error message.
description: In the attached message box, the "(yes/no)" is superfluous.

Title: Eclipse update site should be availble out of the box in the SDK
description: The eclipse update site http://download.eclipse.org/updates should be available out of the box when I search for new features to install. This will open the door to make other add-on components easily available from there for new users.

Title: [Workbench] Perspectives show up twice in chevron
description:
M9

If you select the chevron on the end of the perspective switcher it will show 
some perspectives twice.

STEPS
1) Start Eclipse
2) Switch to the CVS perspective
3) Click on the chevron - Resource shows up twice.

Title: Dialogs that are delayed open should not open on a disposed parent
description:
Anything with setOpenOnRun() to false needs to be sure that it does not open 
if the parentShell is disposed.

The preferred method of repair is to just reset the parentShell if it is 
disposed but this would be an API change which it is too late to do. I am 
going to change the open method of ProgressMonitorFocusJobsDialog to only open 
if the parent shell is null or disposed.

This affects callers of busyCursorWhile. If they call this from a dialog we 
will not open the progress monitor dialog if it has been closed. As a result 
callers of it should disable thier buttons or close thier dialog (I will 
update the javadoc).

Title: editor gets confused, highlighting goes berserk, can't save
description:
RC2 and RC3 have both had this behavior for me.  I am editing Java, with plain 
vanilla eclipse (no plugins added).  I may have 10-20 editors open in 2 top-
level windows.  Using Java perspective, sometimes with a debug perspsective 
open also.  I'll be editing along, and suddenly all the highlighting goes 
subtly wonky throughout one of the editors (others stay fine) - it "seems" to 
be somewhat random.  Half of a large number of words will be a different 
color, some words will be partially italicized, basically the syntax coloring 
will be completely wrong, (with no syntax errors), etc.  This is the first 
warning sign.  If I then try to save the file (ctrl-S) - nothing seems to 
happen.  The file still shows the asterisk indicating it has unsaved changes.  
File->save from the menu bar also appears to do nothing.  Ctrl-Shift-S also 
does nothing.  If I try to exit, it prompts me about an unsaved file, but 
trying to save at that point does nothing either.  Finally I copy/paste from 
the screen to a notepad window and exit without saving.  Restart eclipse, 
paste the file and save, and continue.  There is nothing in .log that I can 
correlate to this.

There is another variation too - if I close just the one file, without saving 
changes, after the initial save attempt appears to do nothing, then re-open 
the same file (without restarting eclipse), the file starts life with the 
asterisk marker.  Sometimes, the changes I made in the earlier edit session 
are there too, indicating that the initial save must have done something.  
Sometimes (usually), if I hit save again at this point the file appears to 
save, the asterisk disappears, and I can continue.  Usually though I am too 
nervous about file integrity to do this and I restart eclipse anyway.

Sorry for the symtoms-only report, but I have so far seen no exact correlation 
with what I am doing in the UI to this problem occuring.  It happens at random 
to a Java file I am actively editing.  It seems to happen relatively soon 
after I switch the focus to that file, and I usually only have a few lines of 
changes at risk.  It does not seem to matter how many editors I have open.  It 
happens 4-5 times per day when I am using eclipse basically all day.  It may 
happen the very first time I touch a particular file, or when I go to edit 
that file for the 10th time that day.

Title: [RCP] Move progress view into ui.workbench plugin
description:
The bulk of the concurrency UI is available directly in 
org.eclipse.ui.workbench except for the progress view.  It appears to be 
defined in org.eclipse.ui.ide and therefore if you wish to include the progress 
view in your RCP app, you must include the ide plugin (and more plugins that 
ide requires).  

Can the progress view please be moved into a non-IDE plugin.  

Currently, if you don't include these plugins, when you run a Job the progress 
view button appears in the status line, but the progress view is not able to 
open.
